intro: Cailliella praerupticola, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often with a compact rosette form. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Cailliella praerupticola is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
